content: blanket look smoother and more even because chains can be awkward to crochet into see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet-fdc/ for a video tutorial csdc chainless starting double_crochet optional a method for beginning each row without having to chain this method helps to keep your edges straight and makes it easier to count and keep track of the number of stitches in each row see https //www mooglyblog com/improved-csdc/ for a video tutorial pattern notes to make a symmetrical blanket using a gradient yarn begin crocheting using the yarn at the darker- colored end of the first skein the skein of yarn will run out at the lighter-colored end join the second skein of yarn by starting to use it from its lighter end and crochet through to finish the skein at its darker end for a symmetrical adult throw add the third skein of yarn at its darker end then add the fourth skein of yarn at its lighter end to finish the blanket at the darker color grateful blanket crochet pattern © 2023 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful baby/kids blanket row 1 chain 110 double_crochet in the 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st double_crochet stitch and all chains across turn 108 double_crochet stitches made or fdc 108 stitches turn see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 108 double_crochet stitches made row 2-79 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet into each stitch turn 108 double_crochet stitches in each row adult throw blanket row 1 chain 138 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st double_crochet stitch and all chains across turn 136 double_crochet stitches made or fdc 136 stitches turn see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 136 double_crochet stitches made row 2-128 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet into each stitch turn 136 double_crochet stitches in each row fasten_off and weave in ends block if desired grateful blanket crochet pattern © 2023 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful
